casebody.data:
PEOPLE v. SEARS et al. (Supreme Court, Appellate Division, Third Department. June 24, 1909.) Appeal from Schenectady County Court. Fred Sears and others were convicted of violating a city ordinance, and they appeal. Reversed.

Argued before SMITH, P. J., and CHESTER, KELLOGG, COCHRANE, and SEWELL, JJ.

John H. Gleason, for appellants. Walter Briggs, Dist. Atty., for the People. PER CURIAM.

Judgments of the County Court and Police Court reversed, upon the opinion in People v. Baum (decided herewith) 118 N. Y. Supp. 3.
